intro: Verbascum × brockmuelleri, commonly known as the hybrid mullein, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy leaves that resemble those of the common mullein. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers in late summer, which are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens for its striking appearance.
